name: cageseq-tss-annotation
title: CAGE-seq: Transcription Start Site Annotation
description: CAGE-seq maps 5' transcript ends to identify transcription start sites, promoters, and enhancers with single-nucleotide resolution. Ideal for promoter annotation, alternative TSS discovery, and regulatory element mapping. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,replicate`
content:
CAGE-seq: Transcription Start Site Mapping

CAGE (Cap Analysis of Gene Expression) captures the 5' cap of mRNAs, mapping transcription start sites at single-nucleotide resolution. Essential for promoter annotation, regulatory element discovery, and understanding transcriptional regulation.

Why CAGE-seq?

  • Precise TSS Mapping: Single-nucleotide resolution (vs RNA-seq)
  • Promoter Identification: Find core promoters, alternative promoters
  • Enhancer RNA Discovery: Bidirectional eRNAs from active enhancers
  • Regulatory Analysis: Promoter activity across conditions
  • Transcription Initiation: Direct measurement of Pol II recruitment

Key Outputs

  • CTSS (CAGE Tag Start Sites): Single-nucleotide TSS positions
  • TC (Tag Clusters): Grouped TSSs (promoter regions)
  • Promoter Atlas: Annotated promoter catalog
  • Alternative TSS: Gene-specific TSS usage patterns
  • BigWig Tracks: Genome browser visualization

Perfect for: TSS annotation • Promoter discovery • Alternative promoters • Enhancer mapping • Regulatory genomics
